boardgame.name: Limes
boardgame.description: Two thousand years ago on the borders of the Roman Empire, life goes on as might be expected _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; but barbarians lurk across the border, so not only must the players grow grain in the fields, catch fish, and chop wood, but they must also maintain watchmen in a clever network of watchtowers to keep a lookout for fires and barbarian attacks._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Limes is based on the designer's board game Cities, and while the game system is roughly the same, the scoring is completely different. In addition, the tiles in Limes have a different layout from those in Cities. Together, these changes ensure that Limes has become an entirely new game. (Limes includes two sets of cards, one for each player, but if you combine copies of the game, any number of people can play at the same time.)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each player has his own deck of cards. One player shuffles his deck, then places a card at random on the table; each other player takes this same card and places it on the table in his own area. Each player can optionally place one of his figures on this card; once a figure is placed on a card, it cannot be returned to the supply. The second card played (and all subsequent cards) much be placed adjacent to or touching the corner of an already-played card. After each card placement, a player can either place a new figure on this card or move an already-placed figure; a figure can move from one territory to an adjacent territory, e.g., from woods to lake or from grain fields to woods._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends as soon as any player has placed 16 cards in a square (4x4 grid). Each player then receives points as follows:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Farmers receive one point for each connected grain field._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Fishermen receive one point for every house situated directly adjacent to their lake._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Watchmen receive one point for every patch of woods they can see in a straight line (north, east, south, west) from their tower; other watchtowers block their view, so they can't see woods behind those towers._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Woodcutters receive one point for every territory to which they can deliver wood, e.g., every different adjacent territory._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The player with the most points wins, with ties being broken in favor of the player who has the highest score with a single figure._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2014 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players Nominee
2014 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players Winner
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Stadt Land Spielt Limitierter Sonderdruck Tag des Gesellschaftsspiels

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Limes German first edition Publisher: ABACUSSPIELE
German first edition - English rules are available online. Publisher: ABACUSSPIELE
Opened but unplayed.

New in shrink German original box - language independent Order Info: Canadians will be charged tax based on location BC Residents 5% GST + 7% PST All other provinces 5% GST Orders usually will be processed in 1-2 business days We will also be able to ship at US domestic rates. Please contact us for a shipping quote. We will also be able to ship at US domestic rates. Please contact us for a shipping quote. Check out our store for more hard to find games: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=viewuser_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;...

The game is unplayed and still in shrink wrap! I will ship from Germany and I am willing to ship anywhere. Please ask me, for the shipping costs for your land. I will charge shipping at cost. Everything will be well packed. You can pay me through Paypal or bank transfer to my German bank account but any fees charged must be covered by you. If you buy more games, then I make all in one package! We have a large private collection of games. Due to space and time constraints we must rid ourselves of some of the games. Therefore, these are private sales.

Supplied with the official English language rules, this is a two-player tile-laying game themed around the Roman forts known as Limes. Players place their square tiles in a grid and add watchmen to score points from the different terrain on the tiles. The question is who can make better use of the same tiles? It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a clever challenge. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £10.00 (net of UK tax - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country). I charge shipping at cost and I can offer several options (or ask me to get a quote from couriers). To UK addresses: myHermes (2-3 working days, tracked) £2.98 Second class post (2-3 working days) £3.36 First class post (1 working day) £3.96 To other EU countries: Air mail (1 week or so) £6.60 Outside the EU: Air mail in Europe (1 week or so) £5.50 Air mail (about 1 week, no tracking) £8.45 (Australasia)/£7.70 (USA _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere) Surface mail (up to 8 weeks, no tracking) £5.30

Supplied with the official English language rules, this is a two-player tile-laying game themed around the Roman forts known as Limes. Players place their square tiles in a grid and add watchmen to score points from the different terrain on the tiles. The question is who can make better use of the same tiles? It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a clever challenge. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £10.00 (net of UK tax - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country). I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £3.10 (myHermes, takes 3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £6.72 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £5.60 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £8.55 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £7.80 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)

Supplied with the official English language rules, this is a two-player tile-laying game themed around the Roman forts known as Limes. Players place their square tiles in a grid and add watchmen to score points from the different terrain on the tiles. The question is who can make better use of the same tiles? It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a clever challenge. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £10.00 (net of UK tax - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country). I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £2.79 (myHermes, takes 3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £6.96 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £5.80 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £8.70 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £8.05 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)
